box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 222px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 625px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: The 'driver heartbeat' is an async coroutine running on ORCH which issues a /get_status POST request every 10 seconds to all action servers defined in the launch config, regardless of ORCH and action server state.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 212px; height: 1px; padding-top: 660px; margin-left: 65px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: This coroutine makes a lightweight HEAD request to active (running) action endpoints every 10 seconds, to check if the action servers are still responding to API requests.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 272px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 65px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Sequence, experiment, and action queues are instances of 'zdeque', a custom implementation of collections.deque which wraps queue insert/append/appendleft/pop/popleft methods with zstd compression.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 232px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 365px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Serially processes queued actions (actions unpacked from experiment, experiments unpacked from sequence) by checking for action start conditions and sending POST request to respective action servers.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 212px; height: 1px; padding-top: 660px; margin-left: 1245px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: An instance returned by logging.getLogger() which is created by the server process launch script, then inherited by all modules loaded in the same process.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 352px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 875px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: Endpoints are the API methods exposed to action server clients (e.g. ORCH). An action endpoint path is prefixed by the action server name (/PSTAT/) whereas a "private" endpoint path is not. Action endpoints are tracked by ORCH to determine action start conditions. All action servers inherit BaseAPI endpoints in addition to their device/resource specific endpoints.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 202px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 1255px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: The active action instance handles file writing, pushes data and status messages to broadcast queues, and spawns the "action loop" coroutine for processing an Executor task.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 292px; height: 1px; padding-top: 160px; margin-left: 1555px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 330px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: An execution base class containing 5 standardized methods which use driver functions to perform an operation:

ul.li: _poll() # retrieve data and update iter count/time

div.div: Implementation is handled by the inheriting executor subclass (e.g. helao.servers.action.gamry_server2.GamryExecutor). All 5 standard methods are optional. The active action instance will launch helao.base.Base.action_loop_task() to process the 5 standard methods in order.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 292px; height: 1px; padding-top: 500px; margin-left: 1555px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 350px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Driver instance
helao.drivers.helao_driver.HelaoDriver
An instance of a subclass of HelaoDriver, an abstract base class which defines the minimum functionality needed by external driver consumers (e.g. get_status endpoint, executors). all "external" HelaoDriver methods return a DriverResponse object:
connect() # open a connection to device/resource
get_status() # return device/resource status
stop() # interrupt a running driver method
reset() # reinitialize driver connection
disconnect() # release connection
Implementation is handled by the inheriting driver subclass (e.g. helao.drivers.pstat.gamry.driver.GamryDriver). HelaoDriver may be used outside of an action server, so it is recommended to write async consumers of driver methods in a separate module.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 540px; margin-left: 171px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 492px; height: 1px; padding-top: 660px; margin-left: 445px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 150px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p: The default Helao operator is a Bokeh visualization app launched on the same event loop as the Orchestrator. BokehOperator handles parameter entry, sequence/experiment queuing, issuing start/stop/estop to the Orch dispatch loop, monitoring queue progress, and monitoring overall orchestration status.
External operators may be implemented as consumers of the Orch API endpoints (e.g. helao.servers.operator.gcld_operator).

div.p: Websockets are used for broadcasting action server status and active action data to non-critical subscribers, e.g. visualizers (helao.servers.visualizer.gamry_vis).

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
